channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Reflections II: Lockdown 'slowly ate away at my soul'
item.description: After seven weeks away, students flooded back through their school gates on Monday morning - eager for a return to normality.

item.title: Fix or demolish: residents to get say on keeping damaged library
item.description: Wellingtonians could be paying up to $200 million to overhaul the central city's earthquake prone library.

item.title: RNZ wins seven categories at Voyager media awards
item.description: Winners included Guyon Espiner for Reporter of the Year, Aaron Smale for feature writer of the year, Te Aniwa Hurihanganui for MÄori Affairs reporting, and more.

item.title: Covid-19: Engaged, but kept 18,000km apart by lockdown lag
item.description: Corinna is living with Lyme disease and hoping Immigration will let her fiance Colin - stuck in the UK after visiting his sick mum - into New Zealand on humanitarian grounds.

item.title: One new case of Covid-19 in New Zealand after four days of zero cases
item.description: New Zealand has recorded one new case of Covid-19 today, linked to the St Margaret's cluster in Auckland.

item.title: Who is new National Party leader Todd Muller?
item.description: Until this week the name Todd Muller was unfamiliar to many. Today, he has stepped up to wrestle the leadership of the National Party from Simon Bridges.

item.title: Court of Appeal upholds 18-year jail term for Christchurch woman's murder
item.description: A man who murdered a Christchurch sex worker has lost an appeal against his sentence.

item.title: Dale Watene death treated as homicide - police
item.description: Police have launched a homicide investigation into the death of Otautau man Dale Watene.

item.title: As it happened: Covid-19 updates from NZ and around the world
item.description: The Health Ministry is reminding NZers that the maximum number of people who can gather remains at 10 for now, except for funerals and tangihanga.

item.title: Search for missing trampers widened to 'cover all possibilities'
item.description: Police say the lack of details about two missing trampers intentions in Kahurangi National Park leaves a very large area to search.

item.title: Man charged with baby's murder
item.description: A 21-year-old man has been charged with murder after the death of a baby in Auckland last month.

item.title: Police begin inquiry into how baby was injured
item.description: Police in Blenheim are investigating how a baby received head injuries.

item.title: Health Ministry defends time to release Covid-19 tracing app
item.description: The Ministry of Health says it had align the app with other government approaches, get Cabinet approval and ensure privacy before launching the app.

item.title: Reflections: Young people on life in lockdown
item.description: Lockdown was a time some of us might remember fondly; days spent with family, going for walks, pressing the reset button. For others, it was something best forgotten.

item.title: Man critically injured after suspected hit-and-run
item.description: Police in Wairarapa are appealing for information about an apparent hit and run incident in Carterton early this morning.

item.title: Govt provides assistance to regions hardest hit by Covid-19
item.description: More than $36 million has been allocated from the government's workers redeployment package announced in March.

item.title: Friend describes man shot by police in Waitara as a 'tough and cool guy'
item.description: A lifelong friend of the man shot and killed by police in Waitara this week says he doesn't hold a grudge against the officers involved in the death of Alan Rowe - who he simply knew as Snow.

item.title: Covid-19: Road toll jumps back up after lockdown
item.description: The rate of people dying on our roads has jumped back up, following a record low during lockdown.
